comments:
I have a managed C++ project which is checked into a team system (perforce).  Most types of edits 
work as expected;  e.g. if I open a read-only .cpp file, and start typing, the editor seems to notify the 
perforce plug-in, the command "open for edit" is issued, the file is made writeable, and I can start 
typing.

However, this fails when attempting to edit the c/c++ project settings, and .cdtbuild is non-writeable.  
Specific steps:
Right click on the project file, select "properties"
Make some sort of change to C++ properties (e.g. define a new preprocessor #define value)
Close the dialog

Actual results / Specific bugs:
1.  vi .cdtbuild and note that the changes were not committed
2.  No error was noted for the user (silent failure)
3.  Errors written to logfile, workspace/.metadata/.log:
...
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.ResourceException: Could not write to
read-only file: /Servercode/.cdtbuild.
        at
org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.FileSystemResourceManager.write(FileSystemResourceManager.java:
735)
...

Desired results:
1.  Active team plugin used to open .cdtbuild (and/or .cdtproject) for editing


Versions:
fedora core 3, latest updates
eclipse 3.0.1
cdt 2.0.2
p4wsad 2004.2.2485
Let the build folks deal with it

I have implemented a fix to resolve this problem. I have tested my solution for 
the case where the .cdtbuild file is read-only, and the behavior is as 
expected. The fix uses an underlying Eclipse routine that should handle 
interaction with supported source code repositories properly, but I do not have 
access to the repository listed in the problem report. Could the bugzilla 
reporter try the fix in that environment? Regardless, though, what I have done 
definitely improves the behavior that occurs when there are problems attempting 
to write to the .cdtbuild file. 

I believe that this fix will be available in CDT v3.1.

Bob Monteleone
